0.user_question: Tom has 4 bedrooms in his house.  They measure 20 by 12 feet each.  The living room is 5 times bigger than one bedroom.  The rest of the house is 1000 square feet.  What is the total area, in square feet, of the house?

ost_step.1: Each bedroom measures 20 x 12 = <<20*12=240>>240 square feet.
ost_step.2: Tom has 4 bedrooms so their combined area is 4 * 240 = <<4*240=960>>960 square feet.
ost_step.3: One large room (living room) would then take up space equaling five bedrooms which amounts to 5 * 240 =<<5*240=1200>>1200 square feet.
ost_step.4: Combine these areas for all rooms aside from kitchen or bathrooms i.e., Bedrooms(960 sq ft.)+ Living Room(1200sqft)= Total Rooms Area(2160 sq ft.).

direct_answer.text: We know that apart from the kitchens and bathrooms, we only consider the four bedrooms along with the big open space known as 'the lobby'. Given that it states the remaining part of the house equals around 1000 sq ft; this implies its value can vary slightly but essentially remains close enough to fit our calculation purposes. Therefore, when adding both figures together – the size taken up by everything else excluding any other possible spaces like additional closets etc. within those mentioned categories– the resulting figure comes out to about 2160 sq ft plus roughly another thousand makes approximately 3160 sq ft overall.
